pageContext.claim: “I may very well talk to her [Theresa May] about that [alleged spying by Five Eyes members into Trump’s campaign], yeah. There's word and rumor that the FBI and others were involved, CIA were involved, with the UK, having to do with the Russian hoax.”
pageContext.analysis: "Spying" is a loaded word and there's no evidence that the FBI's investigation of Trump's campaign and its contacts with Russia violated any legal limits, though the Justice Department's inspector general is conducting an inquiry. The New York Times reported that the FBI sent an investigator posing as a research assistant to London to ask then-campaign adviser George Papadopoulos whether the Trump campaign had ties to Russia. The FBI had opened a counterintelligence investigation based on Papadopoulos's claims to an Australian diplomat, as had long been known before the Times's story.
